straton_oblivion_fragm.txt.Author: straton_oblivion_fragm.txt
straton_oblivion_fragm.txt.Message: A man cannot ignore the inevitable end of his existence, but we must ask: does the nature of goodness change simply because each life is finite? T//()

Related.Author: straton_oblivion_fragm.txt
Related.Message: A man cannot ignore the inevitable end of his existence, but we must ask: does the nature of goodness change simply because each life is finite? T//()

athena10.txt.Author: athena10.txt
athena10.txt.Message: Athena looked upon the imprisoned titans&( $# moved by their plight. What crimes deserved such punishment? And how did they, in their confinement, avoid the pit of madness?

Related.Author: athena10.txt
Related.Message: Athena looked upon the imprisoned titans&( $# moved by their plight. What crimes deserved such punishment? And how did they, in their confinement, avoid the pit of madness?

reading_gaol.c33.Author: reading_gaol.c33
reading_gaol.c33.Message:
I never saw a man who looked
With such a wistful eye
Upon that little tent of blue
Which prisoners call the sky,
And at every drifting cloud that went
With sails of silver by.

Related.Author: reading_gaol.c33
Related.Message:
I never saw a man who looked
With such a wistful eye
Upon that little tent of blue
Which prisoners call the sky,
And at every drifting cloud that went
With sails of silver by.

reading_gaol.c33.Author: reading_gaol.c33
reading_gaol.c33.Message:
At last I saw the shadowed bars,
Like a lattice wrought in lead,
Move right across the whitewashed wall
That faced my three-plank bed,
And I knew that somewhere in the world
God's dreadful dawn was red.

Related.Author: reading_gaol.c33
Related.Message:
At last I saw the shadowed bars,
Like a lattice wrought in lead,
Move right across the whitewashed wall
That faced my three-plank bed,
And I knew that somewhere in the world
God's dreadful dawn was red.

reading_gaol.c33.Author: reading_gaol.c33
reading_gaol.c33.Message:
Yet each man kills the thing he loves
By each let this be heard.
Some do it with a bitter look,
Some with a flattering word.
The coward does it with a kiss,
The brave man with a sword!

Related.Author: reading_gaol.c33
Related.Message:
Yet each man kills the thing he loves
By each let this be heard.
Some do it with a bitter look,
Some with a flattering word.
The coward does it with a kiss,
The brave man with a sword!

pascal.lz19.Author: pascal.lz19
pascal.lz19.Message: All our dignity consists then in thought. By it we must elevate ourselves, and not by space and time which we cannot fill. Let us endeavor to think well; this is the principle of morality.

Related.Author: pascal.lz19
Related.Message: All our dignity consists then in thought. By it we must elevate ourselves, and not by space and time which we cannot fill. Let us endeavor to think well; this is the principle of morality.

lost.mla.Author: lost.mla
lost.mla.Location: World 3, top of bridge, past purple doors
lost.mla.Message:
&%$& Here at least
we shall be free; the Almighty hath not built Here for his envy, will not drive us hence: Here we may reign secure, and in my choice to reign is worth ambition though in Hell: Better to reign in Hell, than serve in Heaven.

Related.Author: lost.mla
Related.Location: World 3, top of bridge, past purple doors

barbellion_arch.txt.Author: barbellion_arch.txt
barbellion_arch.txt.Message: To me the honour is sufficient of belonging to the universe — such a great universe, and so grand a scheme of things. Not even Death can rob me of that honour. For nothing can alter the fact that I have lived; I have been I, if for ever so short a time.

Related.Author: barbellion_arch.txt
Related.Message: To me the honour is sufficient of belonging to the universe — such a great universe, and so grand a scheme of things. Not even Death can rob me of that honour. For nothing can alter the fact that I have lived; I have been I, if for ever so short a time.

ChurchillCompleteWorks.doc.Author: ChurchillCompleteWorks.doc
ChurchillCompleteWorks.doc.Message: Nothing can be more abhorrent to democracy than to imprison a person or keep him in prison because he is unpopular/&&& This is really the test of civilisation.

Related.Author: ChurchillCompleteWorks.doc

einstein_compl.doc.Author: einstein_compl.doc
einstein_compl.doc.Message: Without creative, independently thinking and judging personalities the upward development of society is as unthinkable as the development of the individual personality without the nourishing soil of the community.

Related.Author: einstein_compl.doc

stapledon1944.tmp.Author: stapledon1944.tmp
stapledon1944.tmp.Message: These three activities, then, intelligence, love and creative action, which are so closely involved in one another, I cannot but feel to be intrinsically good. 474152 4241 47452 E4 44154 &they form the distinctively human kind of behaviour.
